name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with greatest extension.

**Note 2:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1 or T2) based on the tumor size.

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Minimal infiltration of dermis (Not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Subcutaneous tissue (Through entire dermis, not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Tumor invades tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin
    Tumor at eyelid margin
    Tumor involves full eyelid thickness

    Localized, NOS

**Note 3:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 4:**  Presence of tumor at eyelid margin takes priority over depth of invasion in dermis/tarsal plate; i.e., code 250 takes priority over codes 100-200.

**Note 5:**  Metastatic skin lesions are coded in distant metastasis.
rows: Stated as T3 [NOS] with no other information on extension

    Globe
